# Instructions to build a custom base image

Get a Dockerhub account.

Build for amd64. Replace your_dockerhub_username with personal username.

```{bash, eval = FALSE}
docker build --platform linux/amd64 -f base_image/Dockerfile.base -t your_dockerhub_username/sim-binom-bayes-base-image:latest .
```

For example, I used:

```{bash, eval = FALSE}
docker build --platform linux/amd64 -f base_image/Dockerfile.base -t mkleinsa/sim-binom-bayes-base-image:latest .
```

Once built, push the image to Docker Hub as usual:

Login to Docker if needed..

```{bash, eval = FALSE}
docker login
```

Push:

```{bash, eval = FALSE}
docker push your_dockerhub_username/sim-binom-bayes-base-image:latest
```
